html: 11.28.17  11:24 pm   I am back from Kentucky which is where I go over Thanksgiving, because I make maps of Mammoth Cave for the parks service. It was nice to get out of the sedentary lifestyle of academia but now I am back and struggling to cope again. Also it seems that if you want to get really good at (capital a) Art, you have to sit down and be kind of boring for a while. Writing and drawing and editing are all good but not (capital f) Fun. The question is: how do you deal with the crippling amount of time that passes each day/week/month/year?
original_html: 11.28.17  11:24 pm   I am back from Kentucky which is where I go over Thanksgiving, because I make maps of Mammoth Cave for the parks service. The question is: how do you deal with the crippling amount of time that passes each day/week/month/year?

11.28.17  1:03 pm   Not to be rude, I love your music and vids so much, and I don't question how hard you work on your content.. but do you think the biweekly schedule is humanly possible?

      I don't know anything about making videos, but is there something in particular that makes that hard to do?

      Like, is the most time consuming aspect come from the creative side of things, as in figuring out exactly how you want all the animations and graphics and stuff to look? Or is it more time consuming to actually make the thing, like is there a lot of reptitive, time-consuming, 'busy work' that goes into making a video?
